Can you use the `curl` command to recover an identity without specifying a username?

No, the provided example shows that when using the `curl` command to recover an identity, you need to specify a username. In this case, the username is `myusername`. The correct syntax for this is `curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "recoveridentity", "params": ['{"name" : "myname"}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/`.

Examples:
```bash
> verus recoveridentity '{"name" : "myname"}'
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "recoveridentity", "params": ['{"name" : "myname"}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
